STATIONERY OFFICE at the following addresses ‘Adastral House, Kingsway, London, W.C.2; 120 George Street, Edinburgh 2 26 York Street, Manchester 1; 1 St. Andrew’s Crescent, Cardiff ; ‘80 Chichester Street, Belfast ; or through any bookseller 1937 Price 4s. od. net Digitized by Google NOTES. Officers and others who may notice errors or omissions in the List are invited to communicate direct with : Tue Secretary of the ADMIRALTY, (Editor of the Navy List) London, S.W.1, mentioning the ship or page affected. Such communications should not be sent to the Printers or Pub- lishers. They should be marked “On His Majesty's Service,” and need not be stamped. The names of Officers om the Retired, d&c., Lists, appear only in the January and July issues of the Navy List. The Contents Table for the Retired Liat appears immediately before the Index to Officers om the Retired, d-c., Lista. The rates of pay, regulations, d&c., are contained in a separate publication entitled “Appendiz to the Navy List” which appears in June and December. The names of Temporary Officers of the Royal Navy, Royal Marines, Royal Naval Reserve and Royal Naval Volunteer Reserve who have granted permission to velain their rank, with the right of wearing uniform on stale and other occasions of ceremony, are not included in the Navy List. No Appointments made after the 18th of the Month preceding pabtence can be inserted in the Navy List until the following ist is published. Officers on the Retired List are required to report their private permanent addresses and any changes therein to the appropriate authorities, as laid down in the regulations for Officers on the Retired List (see Appendix to the Navy Liet). If they are not drawing retired pay or pension, they should also report themselves by letter annually, on or shortlyafter the Ist January, to the Secretary of the Admiralty, or to the Adjutant-General, Royal Marines (for R.M. Officers), in order to ensure that their names are retained in the Navy List. Officers on the Emergency List, Officers of the Special Reserve of Engineer Officers, and Special Reserve, Royal Marines, and Officers of the late Royal Naval Artillery Volunteers must similarly report their addresses annually. Retired and Honorary Officers of the Royal Naval Reserve are required to report periodically as laid down in the R.N.R. (Officers) Regula- tions. Retired and Honorary Officers of the Royal Naval Volunteer Reserve are required to report their addresses annually, on or shortly after the Ist January, to the Admiral Commanding Reserves. It is particularly requested that all Officers whose names appear in the Retired Section of the Navy List and who are not drawing retired pay or pension should leave instructions that, in the event of their death, the fact is to be reported to the appropriate authority as indicated above. “NOTES. iii The removal of an Officer’s name from the Navy List in consequence of failure to report does not involve the termination of his commission or relieve him of the liability for service, if required when Retired, Emergency or Reserve Officers are called out in time of war or emergency. Officers who succeed to peerages, baronetcies, or courtesy titles should immediately notify tie same to the Secretary of the Admiralty, in order that the necessary alterations may be made in the Navy List and in the Official Records of the Admiralty. The degrees shown after Officers’ names in the Navy List are not necessarily & complete list of the D held but, generally speaking, are confined to degrees of an honorary nature conferred specially ie an Officer and degrees which are so related to the professional duties of an Officer as to give some indication of his professional qualifications. The Navy List ts compiled and published by order of the Lords Commissioners of the Admiralty for the convenience of the Service ; but, as errors may occasonally occur, their Lordships must expressly reserve their right to determine the status of an Officer according to the actual circumstances of the case, independ- ently of any Entry in the Navy List. By command of their Lordships, R. H. A. CARTER. CONTENTS. The free advertisements regarding Charities, e., appear at the back of the Navy List.
